meanings.definition: Capable of being the subject of a lawsuit.
meanings.sent1: The litigable case was brought to court for a fair resolution.
meanings.sent2: The litigable dispute between the neighbors required legal intervention.
meanings.sent3: The litigable situation turned into a courtroom drama.
meanings.sent4: Her anger was a litigable storm waiting to erupt.
meanings.sent5: The litigable nature of the contract made it a legal battleground.

meanings.sent1: The evidence presented was litigable and crucial for the case.
meanings.sent2: The litigable documents were submitted to the court for review.
meanings.sent3: His litigable argument made everyone in the courtroom chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The litigable issue was a ticking time bomb waiting to explode.
meanings.sent5: The litigable nature of the matter made it ripe for legal action.
